Lalit Jain

Hi, I'm Lalit Jain a graduate student in mathematics at the University of Wisconsin, Madison.

My research interests revolve around algebraic geometry, topology and number theory. Recently I have also been exploring applications of geometry to machine learning. These days I spend most of my time thinking about monodromy, cycles on moduli spaces, and theoretical problems in the world of active learning. My advisor is Jordan Ellenberg and I have also been working with Robert Nowak.

You can download a copy of my CV here and a copy of my resume here.
